alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 5:14PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wake and southwestern Franklin Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 514 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wake Forest, or 11 miles southwest of Louisburg, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wake Forest, Zebulon, Bunn, Wendell, Rolesville, Youngsville, Pilot and Falls Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
